title: Ethylene glycol poisoning
summary: Ethylene glycol poisoning is poisoning caused by drinking ethylene glycol.[1] Early symptoms include intoxication, vomiting and abdominal pain.[1] Later symptoms may include a decreased level of consciousness, headache, and seizures.[1] Long term outcomes may include kidney failure and brain damage.[1] Toxicity and death may occur after drinking even a small amount.[1]
